ygData.subject: RE: Just a rant, nothing important
ygData.msgSnippet: Well if you think that was bad listen to this.  Yesterday i decided to take a mental health day from work.  I wake up and the first thing I do is go on EQ.  I
ygData.messageBody:
Well if you think that was bad listen to this. Yesterday i decided to take
a mental health day from work. I wake up and the first thing I do is go on
EQ. I logged in and I was at cazic. So I yelled Level 31 cleric looking to
group. So i get into a group to take on Archon. It was me, 2 SK's 2
wizards and a ranger and druid. So we decided We would invis and go up all
the way to archon. Well everyone in the group can invis themselves and I
start screaming for a invis. Noone comes down until they start fighting in
Archon. Then somebody realizes oh we forgot to invis the cleric. Well POOF
a train comes like 5 lizzy I go invun. Getting stuned. Used 2nd
invunerbilty. Well MORE STUNS. Ok I try to gate out. Your spell has been
interupted.5x Well I die. Get to my corpse everyone said sorry. Well you
think thats the end but there is more!!!! Now i lost a level because any
level after hell level you lose a whole bub of exp. So now I am level 30.
Ok we all go to Archon room there are about 5 to 7 lizzy. My invisibilty
fades. I START SCREAMING I NEED INVIS. But noone there invis me. Well that
nice little jucidor and his 3 brothers tried to cast wrath on me also the
crudader used his harm touch on me as well/ Hehehehe Used a invunerbily
before he gets the spell off. So the wizzy says I AM GOING TO USE EVAC.
Well he gets the spell off while we were winning the fight and boom we are
in North Karana. We rest up and everyone invis themselves BUT ME. The
wizard gates to the wizard portal in Cazic with me with NO INVIS. Well if
anyone has ever been there, there are always at least 3 lizzy hanging
around there. Well I used my last invunerbilty then tried to gate. The
first gate was interupted down to 80%. 2nd gate intterupted 60% 3rd gate
interupted 30% 4th gate interupted 20% 5th gate worked with 19HP. I said
to the group I am leaving since you have no clue how important the cleric
is. I left and decided I was going to go to Rathe mountains. Well Mr. Hurd
showed me what a real ass whoopin is. Died lost level 31 again. Back to
30. Played all last night still havent gotten that level back. The moral of
the story. HELL LEVEL SUCKS.


Qanin Skywanderer
The Rathe 30th Circle Cleric
> ----------
> From: Chris Wheeler[SMTP:wheelech@...]
> Reply To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
> Sent: Wednesday, December 08, 1999 9:24 AM
> To: 'EQ-Clerics@onelist.com'
> Subject: [EQ-Clerics] Just a rant, nothing important
>
> From: Chris Wheeler <wheelech@...>
>
> Hi all,
>
> The following is just a rant. Nothing of substance, just me venting about
> last nites gameplay. If you don't want to read it, feel free to skip.
>
>
> Rant.
>
> Well, last nite was just one of those bad group experiences. I have
> recently decided to setup home in Unrest. Granted, its a dangerous place
> for a lvl 16 cleric, but I consider myself a decent enough playe, one who,
> in the words of Kenny Rogers, '..knows when to hold, knows when to fold
> em,
> knows when to walk away, knows when to run...'.
>
> So I start last nite, and within ten minutes have a full group going.
> Thats
> what I love about Unrest, its so easy to get a group going.
>
> Anyways, we have 2 bards, an enchanter, a pally, and 2 clerics. So we
> start. I am nominated as the puller, which i don't like, but what the
> heck.
> So i pull the first few mobs. Each time, we kill something, I immediately
> here the 'ching-ching' sound (looting) and see i receive a split of the
> money. Of course, this is happening during the fighting, as opposed to
> the
> end. So i mention that it would probably be wiser to wait till the fight
> was over before looting, as the mobs in unrest are unruly, and any break
> in
> the fighting could cost us our lives. Plus, it would be nice to get a
> fair
> share of the looting rights.
>
> So we pull more, and of course, more looting during fighting occurs. This
> time I am more adament about the looting. I amthen told by our lowest
> level
> bard that she wants free for all looting. I usually would agree that free
> for all is ok, but I told her that it wouldn't be fair if only one person
> got all the fine steel and bronze. So we conclude that we will ffa the
> money, and alpha the bronze and FS.
>
> Next pull, we get a nasty train. We stay to fight, and we are doing ok,
> until the clerics run out of mana. fortunately, we had killed a few, so we
> got some good xp. But the healing is about to end (oom) and we (the
> clerics) yell RUN-ZONE.
>
> Of course no one listens, they keep fighting, the clerics make it out, two
> of the group die, and the others limp out with a bubble each.
>
> We get blasted by the group... Why didn't you heal, you should have had
> your
> act together... Well, we explain that the we can only heal for as much
> mana
> as we have, and when the clerics say run, its run time.
>
> So we regroup, and go back in. Another train, this time the enchanter
> decides he'll play tank when he goes OOM. We tell him to back off, but no,
> he stays and fights, causing the clerics to wast mana on him for heals.
> He
> died, and of course, blames us.
>
> Wash, rinse repeat. More stupid group moves, more dying. It ranged from
> looting probs to players taking off to 'explore' then dying. And, we had
> the people who were higher in level leave our group (we were abel to
> replace, but anyone with a brain didn't stay in the group long).
>
> In the end, I died once, but it was enough to wipe my Xp for the night,
> and
> I made a total of 3 gold ( i usually make 10pp).
>
> I guess the conclusion is this: Some players think clerics are a
> bottomless
> pit of mana/healing, and any death in a group is always the result of the
> cleric not healing properly/fast enough. My philosophy is tanks first,
> everyone else next, me last. I'll tell you this, I now know who not to
> group
> with in Unrest, or anywhere else for that matter.
>
>
> Brytewing, 16th Cleric of the Rathe.
>
> >
